subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text: {{unk|zh}}. Possibly from a Central Asian language; compare {{cog|mn|-}} {{m|mn|айраг||fermented milk of mares}} and {{cog|tr|ayran||yoghurt mixed with water}}. The phonetic similarity between Chinese {{och-l|酪|milk}}, {{cog|grc|γάλα||milk}} and {{cog|la|lac||milk}}, from {{cog|ine-pro|-}} {{m|ine-pro|*ǵlákts||milk}} is worth noting ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).
